user.title: Set up Sager Weathercaster
user.description: Enter the two required sensors. You can add optional sensors on the next screen.

data_description.name: Name for this Sager Weathercaster instance
data_description.pressure_entity: Entity providing current atmospheric pressure in hPa. Use relative (sea-level) pressure, not absolute station pressure.
data_description.wind_dir_entity: Entity providing current wind direction in degrees (0–360). Use a vector-averaged value, not an instantaneous reading.

optional_sensors.title: Optional sensors
optional_sensors.description: Add any sensors you have available. Each one improves forecast accuracy or enriches the weather entity — none are required to complete setup.

data.wind_historic_entity: Historic wind direction sensor (6 h ago)

data_description.wind_speed_entity: Entity providing current wind speed in km/h. Use a short-term average, not an instantaneous reading.
data_description.wind_historic_entity: Entity providing wind direction from 6 hours ago. Required for wind trend detection (Veering / Backing / Steady).
data_description.pressure_change_entity: Entity providing pressure change over 6 hours in hPa. Required for pressure trend classification.
data_description.cloud_cover_entity: Entity providing cloud cover percentage (0–100 %), solar illuminance (lx), or solar irradiance (W/m²). The integration auto-detects the unit: lx and W/m² are converted using the Kasten & Czeplak clear-sky model. Solar irradiance (W/m²) is the most accurate input as the model was designed for irradiance.
data_description.raining_entity: Rain sensor: numeric (mm/h) for intensity-based conditions (rainy/pouring), or binary sensor for simple rain detection.
data_description.temperature_entity: Entity providing current temperature in °C (for weather entity and shower/flurry detection).
data_description.humidity_entity: Entity providing current humidity percentage (for weather entity). Used as fallback moisture input when no dewpoint sensor is configured.
data_description.dewpoint_entity: Entity providing current dewpoint temperature (°C). When configured, the dewpoint is used directly as the atmospheric moisture reference for the cloud-cover turbidity correction, which is more accurate than deriving it from separate humidity and temperature sensors.

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure Sager Weathercaster
reconfigure.description: Update the sensor entities and name used by Sager Weathercaster.

error.invalid_pressure_unit: Pressure sensor must report in hPa (or mbar). Select a sea-level (relative) pressure sensor.
error.invalid_cloud_unit: Cloud cover sensor must report in `%` (cloud cover percentage), `lx` (solar illuminance), or `W/m²` (solar irradiance). Other units are not supported.

init.title: Sager Weathercaster options
init.description: Select an optional weather entity to supplement the Sager forecast with extended forecast data and cloud-cover calibration. Leave blank to use Sager-only local data.

data_description.weather_entity: Any weather entity already set up in Home Assistant (for example `weather.forecast_home` from Met.no, OWM, or AccuWeather). Its hourly and daily forecasts extend the Sager 48-hour window and calibrate the cloud-cover model during clear-sky periods. Do not select the Sager Weathercaster entity itself.

error.cannot_use_own_entity: You cannot select the Sager Weathercaster weather entity as the external weather source.
